conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Homie hops onto an empty barstool, his little legs dangling, and waves to the barkeep with a grin.*

"Well now, this place looks cozy! And appropriately named, eh? *chuckles* I'll take a tankard of your finest gnomish ale, friend! And perhaps... *eyes dart around the room, taking in the patrons and their belongings* ...perhaps a little look around while I wait. Just stretching my legs, you understand! Wouldn't want them to get cramped, being a gnome and all. "

*Homie subtly begins to assess the room. He's looking for a mark - someone with a loose coin purse, an unattended valuable, or perhaps someone who just looks ripe for a bit of harmless trickery. He takes a sip of the ale, savoring the taste as his eyes continue to scan.*

"Say, barkeep, you wouldn't happen to know if there are any interesting games of chance happening around here tonight, would you? Or perhaps... any juicy rumors floating about?" *Homie gives the barkeep a disarming, innocent smile* "A little gnome like me needs some entertainment, you see!"

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Bob chuckles, wiping down the bar with a practiced hand*

"Evening, Homie! Good to see you, as always. The usual, eh? Tankard of gnomish ale coming right up."

*Bob fills a tankard with a frothy, amber-colored ale and slides it across the bar to Homie.*

"Now, as for games of chance... Old Man Fitzwilliam usually has a dice game going in the back corner on evenings like this, but I wouldn't bet the shirt off your back, mind you. He's got loaded dice, everyone knows it, but he's part of the charm of the place."

*Bob leans in slightly, lowering his voice.*

"And rumors? Well, word on the street is that the merchant caravan from Silverwood was attacked on the Old Forest Road. Goblins, they say. Nasty business, that. Folks are saying the road's not safe for travel anymore. Could drive up prices on goods, that's for sure."

*Bob gives Homie a knowing look.*

"Just be careful where you stretch those little legs of yours, Homie. Wouldn't want you getting into any trouble now, would we?" *Bob winks.* "This is a friendly place, but even friendly places have their limits, if you catch my drift."

*Bob grabs a rag and heads down to the end of the bar to serve another customer*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Homie takes another long swig of the ale, savoring the taste and letting Bob's words sink in. He nods slowly, a thoughtful expression on his face.*

"Goblins on the Old Forest Road, eh? Nasty business indeed." *He drums his fingers on the bar, considering.* "And Fitzwilliam with his loaded dice... Sounds like a recipe for separating fools from their coin. Always a tempting proposition!"

*Homie grins at Bob's departing form, though he's too far away to see it.*

"Trouble? Me? Never!" *He chuckles softly to himself.* "But a little... *opportunity*... is always welcome."

*He finishes his ale, then hops off the barstool, his eyes twinkling with mischief.*

"Well, Bob, much obliged for the drink and the information! I think I'll go... *stretch my legs* a bit, as you suggested. See if I can't find this Fitzwilliam and his game. And maybe... just *maybe*... see if those goblins left anything interesting behind on the Old Forest Road."

*Homie strolls casually towards the back corner of the tavern, where he suspects Old Man Fitzwilliam is holding court. As he walks, his fingers lightly brush against the pouches and pockets of the patrons, his senses alert for any sign of easy pickings. He's not necessarily planning to steal anything (yet), but a good thief is always prepared.*

I'll roll a perception check to see if I notice anything interesting on the way: *rolls a d20... 14! Plus my +3 modifier for a total of 17*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Bob watches Homie saunter off towards the back, a familiar mix of amusement and concern on his face.*

*He shakes his head slightly, then calls out good-naturedly, not loud enough to draw unwanted attention, but enough for Homie to hear:*

"Just remember what I said, Homie! A little harmless fun is one thing, but don't go stirring up trouble you can't handle. Goblins are serious business, and Fitzwilliam... well, he's got friends in low places."

*Bob then pauses, feigning a sudden thought.*

"Oh, and Homie! Since you're feeling so generous, how about you pick up the tab for that round of ale you just finished? *Bob pats his apron where his coin purse sits, hinting at his wariness.* Wouldn't want to forget your dues now, would you?"

*With a wink and a subtle nod towards the direction Homie is headed, Bob returns to wiping down the bar, keeping a watchful eye on his small friend's movements, as well as the other patrons in the tavern, just in case.*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Homie stops in his tracks, a mischievous grin spreading across his face as he hears Bob's words. He turns back towards the barkeep, striking a pose of mock innocence, hands spread wide.*

"Stirring up trouble, Bob? Me? *Never!* I'm just a humble gnome, seeking a bit of harmless amusement. Besides, what trouble could *I* possibly cause?" *He gestures to his diminutive stature with a touch of dramatic flair.* "I'm barely taller than a barstool!"

*He ambles back toward the bar, reaching into his own pouch with a theatrical sigh.*

"Alright, alright, Bob, you got me. Can't pull the wool over your eyes, can I? A gnome's gotta pay his dues, after all. Wouldn't want to tarnish my reputation as an upstanding... uh... patron of this fine establishment."

*He plunks down a few coins onto the bar, making sure to count them out with exaggerated care.*

"There you go, my good man. A fair price for a fine ale. And now," *He winks conspiratorially,* "back to my quest for... *harmless amusement!*"

*Homie turns once more towards the back of the tavern, but this time, he makes a slight detour. He subtly bumps into Bob as he passes, using the opportunity to attempt a bit of sleight of hand. He'll try to lift a few coins from Bob's apron without him noticing.*

"Oops, pardon me, Bob! Clumsy little feet, you know how it is." *He chuckles softly.*

Okay, let's roll a Sleight of Hand check for that little maneuver! That's a 12 plus my +6 modifier for a total of 18! Hope Bob's not too observant!

*Homie resumes his stroll towards Fitzwilliam's game, a little lighter in his step and, hopefully, a little heavier in his pockets.*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Bob watches Homie approach, a knowing smile playing on his lips. He's seen Homie's tricks before, many times over. As Homie bumps into him, Bob subtly tenses, his hand instinctively going to his apron pocket to subtly check the weight of his coin purse.*

*Insight check: rolls a d20... 8 + 3 = 11.*

Hmm, Homie is a slippery one, and I'm not feeling as sharp as usual, but I did notice the bump...

"Careful there, Homie! Wouldn't want you knocking over any drinks now. Wouldn't want to add to your tab, eh?"

*Bob pointedly looks down at his apron pocket with a raised eyebrow, giving Homie a chance to return any lifted coins before making a scene. He keeps his voice light, maintaining the tavern's friendly atmosphere, but the message is clear.*

"Off you go now, find your harmless amusement. And Homie... try to keep your hands to yourself."

*Bob watches Homie head towards Fitzwilliam's game, shaking his head with a chuckle. He then resumes wiping down the bar, but this time, he makes sure to secure his coin purse a little tighter in his apron pocket, just in case. He also subtly glances towards Fitzwilliam's corner, keeping an eye on both Homie and the card game, ready to intervene if necessary. As Bob resumes his work he mutters* "That Gnome is always up to no good. I swear, one day I will catch him red handed!"

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Homie freezes momentarily, a sheepish grin creeping onto his face. He knows he's been caught... or at least, strongly suspected. Bob's too sharp for his own good!*

"Caught red-handed, eh, Bob? You wound me! I was merely... uh... testing the structural integrity of your apron." *He chuckles innocently, then sighs dramatically.* "Fine, fine, you win this round, my observant friend."

*Homie reaches into his own coin pouch and produces the few coins he'd managed to lift from Bob's apron (or, at least, *hoped* he'd managed to lift). He places them back onto the bar with a flourish.*

"There you go, Bob. As good as new! Consider it a... uh... *deposit* on future services. You know, for when I inevitably need another tankard of that fine gnomish ale."

*Homie winks, then adopts a more serious tone (well, as serious as a gnome thief can get).*

"But fear not, my friend! I wouldn't dream of causing any *real* trouble in your establishment. I value my access to this fine ale far too much!"

*He straightens up, pats his vest, and flashes a charming (if slightly disingenuous) smile at Bob.*

"And now, onward to Fitzwilliam and his... *fascinating* game of chance! Wish me luck, Bob! Or perhaps... wish *them* luck!" *He winks again.*

*Homie turns and continues his stroll towards the back corner of the tavern, where the dice game is in full swing. As he approaches, he makes a point of keeping his hands visible, just to reassure Bob (and anyone else who might be watching) that he's on the up-and-up. But as he gets closer to the game, his fingers start to twitch with anticipation...*

*I'll roll a perception check to get a sense of the dice game and Fitzwilliam.* Let's see... *rolls a d20... 6! Plus my +3 modifier for a total of 9.*

*Ugh, not a great roll. I'll still proceed with caution, but it seems I'm not getting a clear read on the situation yet.*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Bob chuckles, wiping down the bar with a rag*

"Structural integrity, eh? That's a new one, Homie. I'll have to remember that. But a deposit is a deposit, and I appreciate the gesture."

*Bob scoops up the returned coins, giving them a quick glance to make sure they're all there before dropping them back into his coin purse*

"Just remember what I said, now. Fitzwilliam's game ain't for the faint of heart, or the light of coin. And those goblins out on the Old Forest Road are more trouble than they're worth, even if you *did* manage to find something shiny they left behind."

*Bob watches Homie head towards the dice game, a weary but fond expression on his face. He knows he can't stop Homie from being Homie, but he can at least try to steer him clear of real danger*

"Luck to ya, Homie," *Bob calls out, his voice just loud enough to be heard over the tavern's din.* "But remember, sometimes the best luck is knowing when to walk away."

*Bob turns back to his work, polishing a tankard with practiced ease. He keeps one ear open to the sounds of the dice game, ready to intervene if things get too heated. He also glances around the tavern, making sure all his other patrons are behaving themselves. After a short pause he sighs loudly* "Oh, to be young and making terrible decisions again..." *He starts to chuckle to himself, then he begins to mumble to himself as he is wiping down the bar.* "Let's see here, need to refill the mead soon, and I believe that orc over there needs another drink."

*Bob grabs the mead cask and begins filling it up, being careful not to spill any*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Homie approaches the dice game, his eyes scanning the scene with a mixture of curiosity and calculation, trying to piece together what he missed with his poor Perception check.* Bob's words echo in his mind: *"Fitzwilliam's game ain't for the faint of heart, or the light of coin."*

"Well, I'm certainly not faint of heart!" *Homie mutters to himself, puffing out his chest a little despite his diminutive stature.* "And as for coin... well, a little risk never hurt anyone, right?"

*He sidles up to the edge of the game, trying to get a better look at the players, the dice, and Fitzwilliam himself. He keeps his hands visible, remembering Bob's warning, but his fingers still twitch with anticipation.*

"Evening, gents!" *Homie says, his voice cheerful and friendly.* "Mind if I watch for a bit? I'm just a humble gnome, looking to learn a thing or two about the finer points of... *dice-based entertainment*."

*He gives Fitzwilliam a particularly charming smile, hoping to disarm any suspicion.*

"I wouldn't dream of interfering, of course. I'm just here to observe and admire your... *skill*." *He emphasizes the word "skill" with a knowing wink, implying that he's aware that luck might play a bigger role than talent.*

*He leans in slightly, pretending to be fascinated by the dice rolling, but in reality, he's trying to assess the situation. Are the players honest? Is Fitzwilliam cheating? Are there any tells or patterns he can pick up on? And most importantly... is there an opportunity for a little... *advantageous maneuvering*?*

*Homie rolls another perception check to try and read the scene again. Let's see... *rolls a d20... 15! Plus my +3 modifier for a total of 18.* Much better!*

"That is some seriously good mead, Bob!" *Homie exclaims towards Bob at the bar, hoping to ease any worries that Bob may have about him.*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Bob, hearing Homie's comment about the mead, beams with pride, even though he's still keeping a watchful eye on the gnome thief.*

"Why thank you, Homie! I make it myself, you know. Secret family recipe, passed down through generations. Good to see you're appreciating the finer things in life, even while you're...observing the dice game."

*Bob pauses, polishing a mug with a slow, deliberate motion, his gaze drifting back towards Homie and the dice game. He leans forward slightly, resting his elbows on the bar, his voice taking on a more serious tone.*

"Just remember what I said, Homie. Fitzwilliam's a sharp one. Don't get too carried away with your 'observing'. Some things are best left unseen, and some coins are best left in your own pocket."

*Bob sighs and shakes his head, then returns to polishing the mug, his tone becoming lighter again.*

"But hey, who am I to judge? Just be careful, alright? And if you need anything, you know where to find me. Mead's on the house if you get yourself into a real pickle."

*He winks at Homie, then turns his attention back to the other patrons in the tavern, scanning the room for any signs of trouble. He may trust Homie to a certain extent, but he also knows that gnomes have a knack for getting into trouble, and he's not about to let anything ruin the warm, inviting atmosphere of The Tipsy Gnome.*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Homie beams at Bob, appreciating the barkeep's veiled warning and the offer of free mead (should things go south, of course).*

"Thanks, Bob! You're a true friend! And don't you worry, I'll be careful. I'm just here for the... *ambiance*." *He gives a mischievous grin.* "Though, I must say, the ambiance would be improved with a little more of that fine mead. Perhaps after I've finished my... uh... *research*."

*Turning back to the game, now with a much better sense of the players and the overall situation, Homie clears his throat and addresses Fitzwilliam.*

"So, Fitzwilliam, is it? A pleasure to make your acquaintance! I couldn't help but notice the... *unique* dice you're using. Are those custom made? They certainly have a certain... *je ne sais quoi*."

*Homie subtly moves closer, trying to get a better look at the dice without being too obvious. He wants to see if they are weighted, loaded, or otherwise tampered with. He also keeps an eye on Fitzwilliam's reactions, looking for any tells or nervous habits.*

*I will roll a Sleight of Hand check as I lean in to "admire" the dice. With a flick of the wrist, I'll try to get one of the dice into my hand while they are on the table.* Let's see... *rolls a d20... 4! Oof. Plus my +6 modifier for a total of 10. Well, that was not discreet!*

"Oh dear!" *Homie says with a wince, feigning clumsiness.* "My apologies! I seem to have gotten a bit too close. These old gnome eyes aren't what they used to be!" *He steps back slightly, hoping that his poor roll and quick recovery didn't arouse too much suspicion.*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Bob is polishing a tankard when he hears Homie's "Oh dear!". He stops polishing the tankard and squints his eyes to get a better view of the situation in the back corner.*

*Insight check: *rolls a d20... 12! Plus my +3 modifier for a total of 15.*

*Bob sighs softly.* "Homie, Homie, what am I going to do with you."

*Bob sets the tankard down with a *thunk* and walks over to the dice game, wiping his hands on his apron as he goes.*

"Alright, break it up, you lot! Show's over for tonight." *Bob says in a loud voice. "Fitzwilliam, you know the rules. No funny business in my establishment. And Homie,"* *Bob turns to the gnome thief, a stern look on his face,* "back to the bar with you. You've had enough 'ambiance' for one evening."

*Bob turns to Fitzwilliam with a meaningful look.* "Fitzwilliam, a word. In private." *Bob gestures towards the storage room in the back.*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Homie shrinks back a little as Bob approaches, his ears drooping slightly. He knows that tone; it's the "I'm disappointed in you, but I still care" tone. He shuffles his feet, trying to look contrite, but a mischievous glint still dances in his eyes.*

"Aw, Bob, come on! I was just admiring Fitzwilliam's... *artistic* dice. No harm done, right?" *Homie glances sideways at Fitzwilliam, a sheepish grin on his face.* "Besides, I haven't even had a chance to win back my structural integrity deposit! And there's that mead that you mentioned!"

*Knowing that Bob is not going to budge, Homie sighs dramatically and throws his hands up in mock surrender.*

"Alright, alright, you win. Back to the bar it is. But I'm holding you to that mead, Bob!"

*As he turns to leave the dice game, Homie gives Fitzwilliam a quick wink and a barely audible whisper:* "We'll continue this later, perhaps when Bob's not looking."

*He makes his way back to the bar, trying to look dejected, but his mind is already racing, and he's going to be ready to grab that mead, in case things go sour. I'll take up a seat at the bar and wait for Bob to finish his "private word" with Fitzwilliam, all the while I will keep an eye and ear on them both.*

"So, Bob," *Homie says, hopping up onto a bar stool with a practiced ease.* "What's this 'private word' about? I hope it's not about my... *enthusiastic* interest in dice. And could I get that mead you promised to the gnome who wasn't causing any trouble?"

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Bob sighs, a weary but fond expression on his face as he watches Homie shamble back to the bar. He finishes ushering Fitzwilliam into the storage room before turning back to the gnome.*

*Bob walks behind the bar, grabs a clean tankard, and fills it with the honey-golden mead.* "Here you go, Homie. On the house, just like I said." *He slides the tankard down the bar to Homie with a *thunk*.*

"That 'private word' is just between me and Fitzwilliam, Homie. Nothing for you to worry your pointy little head about." *Bob says, a hint of amusement in his voice.* "Just making sure he keeps things fair and square in my establishment. You know I can't abide cheatin' at the dice."

*Bob leans in closer to Homie, lowering his voice.* "And as for you not causing trouble... well, let's just say your definition of 'no trouble' and mine might be a bit different, eh?" *Bob winks at Homie, then straightens up and addresses the rest of the tavern.*

"Alright folks, everything's fine here. Just a friendly reminder to keep things civil and enjoy your evening!"

*Bob glances back at the storage room door, then turns back to Homie.*

"Now, drink your mead and try to stay out of trouble for five minutes. That's all I ask."

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Homie grins at Bob, his eyes twinkling as he accepts the tankard of mead.*

"Trouble? Moi? Never!" *He says with mock innocence, taking a long, appreciative swig of the mead.* "This is exquisite, Bob! Just the thing to soothe my ruffled feathers after being so unfairly accused of... well, whatever it is I was accused of."

*Homie takes another sip, savoring the honeyed flavor.*

"But seriously, Bob, you know I've got a nose for this sort of thing. Fitzwilliam's got shifty eyes and even shiftier dice, if you ask me. And I'm sure that 'private word' is very important, but wouldn't it be even *more* effective if someone... say, a small, stealthy gnome... were to, oh, I don't know, *accidentally* leave the door ajar a tiny crack? Just enough to, shall we say, *improve the ambiance* with a bit of their conversation?"

*Homie winks, his gaze shifting subtly towards the storage room door. He's not about to blatantly disobey Bob, but a little plausible deniability never hurt anyone. I'll roll a Stealth check to try to creep near the door.*

*Rolls a d20... 18! Plus my +6 modifier for a total of 24!*

"Speaking of ambiance," *Homie continues, sliding off his stool and sauntering casually towards the storage room, trying to look as if he's simply stretching his legs.* "I think I need to... *adjust* my belt. It seems to have gotten a bit tight after all this mead."

*He subtly moves towards the door, using his small size and impressive stealth skills to try to get close enough to subtly push the door ajar without being noticed. I'll press my ear against the door to try to listen to what they are talking about.*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Bob watches Homie with a mixture of amusement and exasperation as the gnome slides off his stool, the "adjusting belt" excuse raising a skeptical eyebrow.*

*Perception check to notice the movement to the door: *rolls a d20... 10! Plus my +3 modifier for a total of 13.*

*Bob sighs, catching Homie's little game but deciding to play along, for now.*

"Alright, Homie, you wily little gnome," *Bob says, a grin spreading across his face*. "Adjust your belt all you want, but I swear, if I hear one peep out of you near that door, you'll be scrubbing the latrines for a month! And that's *after* I introduce your structural integrity to the alley wall outside."

*Bob chuckles, but his eyes hold a firm warning. He knows Homie's intentions, and while he might be curious himself, he can't let the gnome blatantly eavesdrop. It wouldn't be fair to Fitzwilliam.*

*Bob picks up a rag and starts wiping down the bar, keeping a close eye on Homie while pretending to be engrossed in his cleaning.*

"Just remember what I said, Homie. A little stretching is fine. A full-blown listening party is not."

*He pauses, then adds with a wink*

"Besides, you know I'll tell you all the juicy bits later. You just gotta be patient."

*Bob resumes cleaning, listening intently for any sounds from the storage room and from Homie near the door.*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Homie freezes mid-saunter, his hand hovering near his belt buckle. Bob's words hit their mark, a mix of playful threat and genuine warning. He sighs dramatically, feigning disappointment.*

"Latrine duty? Bob, you wound me! Is that any way to treat a valued patron? And after I just complimented your exquisite mead!" *Homie puts a hand to his chest in mock offense.*

*He slowly straightens up, abandoning his "belt adjustment" ruse. He glances at the storage room door, then back at Bob, a mischievous glint in his eyes.*

"Alright, alright, point taken. No listening party. *For now.* But just so we're clear," *Homie says, hopping back onto the bar stool with a nimble leap*, "if any particularly *shiny* bits of information happen to waft my way, I can't be held responsible for what my ears overhear."

*Homie takes another long swig of mead, trying to look innocent. He decides to switch tactics. Subterfuge might not work with Bob on high alert, but perhaps a bit of reverse psychology will.*

"Actually, now that I think about it, I'm suddenly overcome with a profound sense of... *respect* for personal privacy. Yes, that's it! Eavesdropping is simply not the gnome way. We're far too busy polishing our mushrooms and collecting shiny trinkets to engage in such scandalous behavior."

*He pauses, tapping his chin thoughtfully.*

"Speaking of shiny trinkets, Bob, have you seen that new brooch Old Man Fitzwilliam is wearing? The one that looks suspiciously like it contains a large diamond? It would be terrible if someone with a penchant for shiny things suddenly found it... *missing.*"

*Homie winks slyly, subtly changing the subject from eavesdropping to the potential for more lucrative activities. He'll keep an eye on Fitzwilliam, using Bob's "private word" as a distraction.*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Bob leans on the bar, watching Homie's performance with a knowing smirk. He shakes his head slowly, a chuckle rumbling in his chest.*

"Homie, you're a master of misdirection, I'll give you that," *Bob says, wiping down the bar with a practiced hand*. "But don't think for a moment I've forgotten your sticky fingers and penchant for 'shiny trinkets'."

*Bob stops wiping the bar and looks directly at Homie, his eyes twinkling with amusement and warning.*

"And as for Fitzwilliam's brooch... I'd advise you to admire it from afar. Last thing I need is a brawl breaking out over a bauble. Besides," *Bob lowers his voice slightly, leaning closer to Homie*, "that brooch ain't what it seems. Trust me, you'd be better off leaving it be."

*Insight check to see if Homie is telling the truth: *rolls a d20... 12! Plus my +3 modifier for a total of 15.*

*Bob straightens up, clapping his hands together.*

"Now, enough about brooches and eavesdropping. How about another tankard of that exquisite mead? Or perhaps you're in the mood for some of my famous Gnome Nibblers? They're guaranteed to keep you from getting into too much trouble... for at least an hour, anyway."

*Bob glances towards the storage room door, then back at Homie, a silent message passing between them. He's handling the situation with Fitzwilliam. Homie just needs to stay put, drink his mead, and try to be a model patron for once.*

"So, what'll it be, Homie? More mead, or some Nibblers?"

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Homie ponders Bob's words, stroking his chin thoughtfully. He seems to be telling the truth... mostly. Something about that brooch is definitely off, and Bob clearly doesn't want him getting involved.*

"Hmm, a wise gnome knows when to heed good advice," *Homie says with a shrug, hopping off the stool again*. "And since you're offering, Bob, I think I'll take you up on those Gnome Nibblers. My stomach's been rumbling like a grumpy badger anyway!"

*Homie wanders over to the bar, leaning against it as he waits for the snacks. He tries to act casual, but his eyes keep flicking towards the storage room door, his curiosity piqued by Bob's cryptic warning about the brooch. He leans in closer to Bob, lowering his voice.*

"So, Bob, since you're being so generous with the food and all, maybe you could enlighten me about this mysterious brooch? What's so special about it? Is it cursed? Haunted? Does it grant wishes? Enquiring gnomes must know!" *Homie asks, his eyes wide with mock innocence.*

He'll roll a Perception check to see if I can catch any subtle clues or reactions from Bob.

*Rolls a d20... 5! Plus my +3 modifier for a total of 8!*

Well, my perception is clearly not on point right now. I'll just have to rely on Bob's good graces for now. Or maybe some clever sleight of hand later to examine the brooch more closely...

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Bob chuckles, reaching under the counter for a small wooden platter.*

"Enlighten you, eh? Well now, Homie, if I told you everything I knew, what secrets would I have left to keep this old tavern interesting?" *He places a generous helping of Gnome Nibblers on the platter - small, savory pastries filled with cheese and herbs.*

"Let's just say that brooch has a history, and not the kind you'd want to get tangled up in. It's best left to those who know what they're doing. Some trinkets are worth more than their weight in gold, and some are worth less than dirt. That brooch, my friend, falls into the latter category."

*He slides the platter across the bar to Homie.*

"Enjoy the Nibblers. They're fresh out of the oven. As for the brooch, take my word for it, there are far shinier, less troublesome things to set your sights on in this world. Besides," *Bob winks*, "I might have a lead on a lost dwarven mine cart filled with uncut gemstones. Now *that* would be a find worth your while."

*Bob leans against the bar, his eyes twinkling with a mixture of amusement and warning. He knows Homie's curiosity is piqued, but he hopes his words will be enough to dissuade the gnome from pursuing the brooch any further. He keeps one ear on the storage room door, where Fitzwilliam is still having his private conversation.*

"Eat up, Homie. And try not to get any crumbs on the bar, eh?"

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
"Ooh, dwarven mine cart filled with uncut gemstones, you say?" *Homie's eyes light up like a goblin's hoard.* "Now *that* sounds like a venture worthy of my... *ahem*... attention."

*I must not get sidetracked from my current goal! I must remain focused on obtaining the gem from behind the bar, my original mission.*

*Homie munches on a Gnome Nibbler, savoring the cheesy, herby goodness. He swallows, then leans in conspiratorially towards Bob.*

"Alright, Bob, you've piqued my interest. Dwarven mine cart details, please! But first..." *Homie gestures vaguely towards the gem behind the bar with his Nibbler.* "What about *that* little shiny trinket over there? Is *that* one of the troublesome ones too, or is it just waiting for a discerning collector to give it a good home?"

*While Bob is distracted by my questions, I'll attempt to discreetly assess the security measures surrounding the gem. I need to know what I'm up against.*

"I'll make a Perception check here to examine the area around the gem while distracting Bob."

*Rolls a d20... 19! Plus my +3 modifier for a total of 22!*

*I am very observant while Bob's attention is elsewhere.*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Homie is persistent, like a gnat buzzing around a honey pot. I need to keep him distracted, but also keep an eye on him while I subtly reinforce the gem's security. Best to play along with his game for now.*

*Bob chuckles, wiping a stray crumb off the bar.*

"Homie, you're like a dog with a bone, aren't you? Can't let anything go once you've got your teeth sunk in."

*Bob throws a practiced glance toward the gem behind the bar, ensuring it's still securely in its display case. He casually adjusts the placement of a nearby tankard, subtly blocking a direct line of sight to the lock.*

"That gem, my friend, is a bit of a special case. It belongs to a rather... influential patron. Let's just say they wouldn't take kindly to it going 'missing'. Unlike Fitzwilliam's bauble, this one actually *is* worth its weight in gold, and then some. Getting caught with it would be a very, very bad idea. Even for you, Homie."

*Bob leans in, lowering his voice conspiratorially.*

"As for the dwarven mine cart... that's a story for another time. One that requires a bit more... lubrication. Let's just say it involves a grumpy dragon, a map hidden inside a bag of holding, and a whole lot of luck. But first things first," *Bob claps his hands together.* "Are you wanting another round of Nibblers or something stronger to wet your whistle? I need to get back to work, and I can't be standin' here all night jawin' with you about lost treasures. Besides, you said you'd leave the gem alone so focus on the mine cart that doesn't exist."

*As he speaks, Bob stealthily checks the clasp on his apron pocket, ensuring his coin purse is secure. He then casually steps between Homie and the display case, subtly positioning himself as a barrier.*

I make a persuasion check to try and persuade Homie to stop asking questions about the gem, while simultaneously steering him towards another topic - the "dwarven mine cart." Rolls a d20... 16! Plus my +4 modifier for a total of 20!

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Bob's persistence is becoming a bit of an obstacle! My perception roll was great and I now know there's a display case with some kind of lock. But, he's making it difficult to get a clear shot at that gem! I need to change tactics. If I can't get information about the gem, I need to find a way to distract Bob long enough to make my move.*

"Alright, alright, you've made your point, Bob. No need to get your beard in a twist!" *Homie says, raising his hands in mock surrender.* "I get it, the gem is off-limits. But a gnome can dream, can't he?"

*Homie pops another Nibbler into his mouth, chewing thoughtfully.*

"So, this dwarven mine cart... a grumpy dragon, you say? And a map hidden inside a bag of holding? Sounds like quite the adventure! Maybe a bit *too* adventurous for a solo gnome. Perhaps a certain barkeep with a knack for tall tales and a penchant for shiny things might be interested in joining forces?" *Homie suggests, winking mischievously.*

*I must try to engage Bob in this adventure, that way I can hopefully get him to temporarily leave the bar! I will go along with his ruse about this dwarven mine cart, and hopefully lure him into a position where I can easily swipe the gem while he is away.*

"Tell me more, Bob! I'm all ears. And maybe, just maybe, a *little* bit tempted to forget all about that boring old gem..." *Homie adds, subtly glancing back at the gem to make sure Bob sees him "forgetting" it.*

*I must prepare to make a move. I must make a Acrobatics check to see how easily I can move around Bob behind the counter, just in case.*

*Rolls a d20... 3! Plus my +5 modifier for a total of 8!*

*It seems I can't do that right now... I can't even hop over the counter, my roll was too low. Better to use a Deception check!*

"Just to be clear, you're positive that gem is more trouble than its worth? Not even worth a quick glance for a seasoned professional like myself?" *Homie says, feigning disinterest and making one last probing Deception check.*

*Rolls a d20... 18! Plus my +5 modifier for a total of 23!*

*Homie smiles winsomely and subtly leans towards Bob, trying to gauge his reaction.*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Homie is laying it on thick, bless his thieving heart. He's clearly trying to distract me, but at least he seems to be buying the 'dangerous gem' act. I need to keep playing along with the mine cart story, but also make sure he doesn't get any closer to the gem. A good tale, a hearty laugh, and maybe a bit of theatrics should do the trick.*

*Bob throws his head back and laughs, a booming sound that fills the tavern.*

"Homie, you sly dog! Trying to get me to spill all my secrets, eh? And maybe lure this old barkeep away from his establishment so you can have a field day?" *Bob winks, clapping Homie on the shoulder - careful to maintain distance from the gem.* "I'm not as green as I am cabbage-looking, my friend. But I appreciate the offer."

*Bob lowers his voice again, leaning closer to Homie, creating a sense of shared conspiracy while subtly moving Homie further away from the gem.*

"The dragon, now, she's a real beaut. Scales the color of amethysts, and a temper that could melt steel. And the map... well, let's just say it's not exactly drawn to scale. More like a child's doodle after a tankard or two of ale."

*Bob pauses for dramatic effect, stroking his chin thoughtfully.*

"But... a seasoned professional, you say? A gnome with a knack for finding things? Hmmm... maybe, just maybe, there's room for a partner in this venture. But only if they can be trusted, and only if they promise to leave certain shiny objects behind the bar untouched."

*Bob raises an eyebrow, looking directly into Homie's eyes. He makes an Insight check (rolls a 12 + 3 = 15) to try and gauge how sincere Homie is being about "forgetting" the gem.*

"Now, about that gem... you seem awfully interested in something you claim to be forgetting. Are you sure you're not just trying to pull the wool over this old barkeep's eyes? If you're truly over it, why mention it again?"

*Bob grabs a clean mug and starts polishing it, keeping a watchful eye on Homie's movements.*

"To prove your genuine interest in this mine cart, you have to drink from my mug, and tell me you aren't plotting anything else in my tavern."

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*This is getting tricky! Bob is on to me, the old fox. But I can play his game. The key is to appear completely disinterested in the gem. Time to commit to the charade and play the part of the eager adventurer.*

*Homie sighs dramatically, putting on his best "disappointed but resigned" face.*

"Alright, Bob, you got me. A gnome can dream, can't he? But you're right, a promise is a promise. Besides," *Homie pats his stomach,* "after those delicious Nibblers, I'm more in the mood for adventure than thievery anyway!"

*Homie reaches for the mug Bob is offering, making sure to maintain eye contact and project sincerity. He needs to sell this act completely.*

"I swear on my grandmother's thimble – and she *really* loved that thimble – that I'm only interested in the dwarven mine cart, the grumpy dragon, and the map hidden in the bag of holding. I won't even *think* about that gem behind the bar."

*Homie pauses, then adds with a mischievous twinkle in his eye,*

"Well, maybe a *little* thought... but only in the context of how much easier it would be to *avoid* getting caught stealing it, given all your warnings. Purely academic, you understand."

*Homie takes a large swig from the mug, savoring the ale. As he drinks, he casually leans against the bar, subtly positioning himself to observe Bob's movements and the layout of the bar from a different angle.*

"Now, about that dragon..." *Homie says, wiping his mouth with the back of his hand,* "what's her weakness? Does she have a soft spot for riddles? Maybe a fondness for gnome-sized adventurers with a knack for getting into trouble?"

*I must change the subject, this is my only shot to pursue this goal, even if it's all lies. While Bob is distracted, I'll attempt to discreetly assess the security measures surrounding the gem. I need to know what I'm up against.*

"I'll make a Perception check here to examine the area around the gem while distracting Bob."

*Rolls a d20... 15! Plus my +3 modifier for a total of 18!*

*I am very observant while Bob's attention is elsewhere. This gives me an idea! I can get Bob to leave by talking to the owner of the gem!*

"Say, Bob, this influential patron... does he come around often? I'd like to speak to them. Maybe they'd be interested in a mine cart of gems for the shiny little gem behind the bar!"

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*Homie is a slippery one, that's for sure. The thimble oath is a nice touch, but I'm not buying it completely. He's still too interested, and the mention of "avoiding getting caught" is a dead giveaway. I need to keep him talking about the mine cart, but also stay alert for any sudden movements.*

*Bob chuckles, shaking his head good-naturedly.*

"Academic, huh? You and your 'academic' interests, Homie. Always gotta be thinkin' about the angles, don't you? Well, I appreciate the honesty, at least. And I appreciate the oath, even if it was about a thimble."

*Bob picks up another mug and starts wiping it down, keeping a close eye on Homie's reflection in the polished surface.*

"As for the dragon's weakness... well, that's a long story, best shared over a few more mugs of ale. Let's just say she's got a soft spot for flattery and shiny objects. Sounds familiar, doesn't it?" *Bob gives Homie a playful nudge.*

*Bob pauses, considering Homie's question about the gem's owner.*

"The gem's owner... they're a bit of a recluse. Don't come around here often, but when they do, everyone knows it. Let's just say they're not the kind of person you want to bother without a good reason. *Especially* if you're planning on trying to swindle them. And their guards? Even worse."

*Bob makes an intimidation check, rolling 18 + 2 = 20, trying to imply that bad things will happen to Homie if he tries to make contact*

"Now, why would you want to bother someone like that?" *Bob asks, raising an eyebrow, with a sterner tone* "If your plan is getting a good job with the gems or whatever, I assure you that this person cannot be trusted, and I will not let you talk to them."

*Bob puts the mug down with a *thunk*, and walks around to the front of the bar*

"Now, about this dragon... Did I tell you she hates gnomes, or was that someone else?" *Bob scratches his beard and looks at Homie expectantly*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Blast! Bob's onto me. He's not going to let me talk to the owner, and he's subtly threatening me. Time to switch gears again. If I can't talk to the owner, maybe I can create a distraction that will draw Bob away from the bar, leaving the gem unguarded, even for a few moments.*

*I need to get Bob away from the bar for any amount of time. So, now I will act clumsy and ask him to fix something to get him to leave the bar area!*

"Oh, uh, well, it was just a thought! No harm in asking, right? Speaking of dragons hating gnomes... hey Bob, is that shelf looking a little... wonky to you?" *Homie points towards a shelf behind the bar, loaded with bottles.* "It looks like it's about to fall down. Maybe it is my small height, but it is definitely leaning."

*Homie feigns concern, hoping to lure Bob into a false sense of security. I'll pretend to accidentally bump into the bar, hoping to exaggerate the "wonkiness" of the shelf. If he is distracted, he can fall right into my trap.*

*With exaggerated clumsiness, Homie stumbles against the bar, causing a few bottles to rattle on the shelf.*

"Oops! Sorry, Bob! Guess I'm not as steady on my feet as I thought. But seriously, that shelf looks like it's about to give way. You might want to take a look before your whole stock ends up on the floor."

*I will quickly try to pickpocket Bob while he is distracted. Bob is in front of me now, so this will be tricky.*

*I'll make a Sleight of Hand check, hopefully to snag his keys so I can unlock the display case!*

*Rolls a d20... 5! Plus my +6 modifier for a total of 11!*

*Blast and bother! My pickpocketing skills have failed me again.*

"Be careful, Bob! Don't want you getting hurt!" *Homie warns, trying to maintain the act while subtly assessing whether Bob has noticed his clumsy attempt.*

*If Bob moves to inspect the shelf, I'll seize the opportunity to make my move. But in the meantime, I must continue to play the part of the concerned patron.*

"I'll need to attempt an Acrobatics check to hop over the bar while he's inspecting the shelf."

*Rolls a d20... 12! Plus my +5 modifier for a total of 17!*

*I might be able to hop over the bar and grab the gem at a moment's notice, depending on what Bob does!*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*This little gnome is persistent, I'll give him that. The shelf trick is transparent, but I can't ignore a potential hazard to my precious bottles. I need to address the shelf without turning my back on Homie or the gem.*

*Bob squints at the shelf, pretending to assess the situation.*

"Now that you mention it, Homie, it *does* look a bit off-kilter. Must be the weight of all those fine spirits," *Bob says, giving the shelf a wary glance, but remaining in front of the bar.*

*Bob makes a Perception check (rolls a 9 + 3 = 12) to quickly scan the shelf without actually moving toward it. I need to see if anything is genuinely out of place.*

"Hmm, I don't *see* anything that seems bad," *Bob says.* "It might look a little off to you because it's up so high."

*Bob pauses, thinking for a moment.*

"Tell you what, Homie, I appreciate you lookin' out for me. I do. But I can't just leave the bar unattended, not with such a valuable item on display," *Bob gestures towards the gem with a wink*. "How about *you* steady the shelf? If it gets too bad, I'll be sure to come up and move the bottles. I am paying you for your services of helping me with the establishment."

*Bob grabs a nearby rag and tosses it to Homie with a sly grin.*

"You can hold the rag, and make sure the bottles don't fall when I walk away."

*Bob decides to call his bluff by moving away from the bar by pouring a drink in another section of the bar.*

*Bob makes a Athletics check to move away from the bar quickly (rolls 4 + 1 = 5)*

"Oops! Guess I'm not as steady as I used to be, because I am old."

*Bob decides to grab Homie's hand and try to move him away from the bar, while he pretends to fall because of how old he is. He makes this move slowly and cautiously.*

"Oh! I am just an old man after all" *Bob says while grabbing Homie's hand*

*I must move him away, because I do not trust him!*

"Here you go friend!" *Bob says while handing him an ale that he was going to pour.*

*Bob makes an insight check while moving (rolls 1 + 3 = 4)*

*This shows that I can move away, but it may be a little unsteady, or suspicious, due to my bad roll.*

*I need to move Homie, but also protect the gem. The best solution to do both is moving Homie to a table! I must do this carefully though.*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*This is a disaster! Bob isn't falling for any of my tricks. He's seen right through the clumsy act and the shelf ruse. I couldn't even pickpocket the keys! Now he's trying to lure me away from the bar, and the gem. Time for a different approach.*

*I need to change the game entirely. If I can't outsmart him, maybe I can out-charm him. I will try to be charming and move to the table, but keep the gem in sight for later theft!*

"Steady the shelf, eh? Well, I appreciate the trust, Bob, but I'm just a little guy! Those bottles could crush me! But I understand your need to protect the place. No worries, I'll keep an eye on it from here. Besides, this ale looks too good to pass up." *Homie flashes a disarming smile, accepting the ale with exaggerated gratitude.*

*He sips the ale, then slides off the bar stool, making sure to maintain eye contact with Bob. I can use this as an opportunity to be a great talker and start the dragon story again*

"That is pretty good! But, you know, speaking of steady, you look like you could use a seat yourself, Bob. You were definitely right! So, maybe we should talk about the dragon?"

*Homie carefully backs away from the bar, keeping the gem in his peripheral vision. As Bob moves him, Homie is a bit unsteady, but remains composed*

"I will do an acrobatics check to make sure I don't look suspicious or too unsteady, despite his attempt to move me! I need to maintain my innocent facade. Gotta make it convincing!"

*Rolls a d20... 16! Plus my +5 modifier for a total of 21!*

*With an unexpected display of agility, Homie manages to maintain his balance perfectly, even as Bob tries to guide him. Homie makes a slight bow as he moves to the chair.*

*Homie then gestures towards a nearby table with a flourish*

"Come on, Bob, let's continue this conversation at the table. More comfortable, better lighting, and less chance of me accidentally knocking over anything else. I am actually interested in that dragon tale! I have not heard of it."

*As he moves towards the table, I will keep the gem within my line of sight. I will be charming and move him, but also keep in sight the main goal. Now is not the time to focus on Bob's attempt to move me, but the gems that are soon to be mine!*

*As I sit down, I smile at him.*

"Maybe the patron would want a dragon guarding all the gems for safekeeping! Have you ever thought about that Bob?"

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*This gnome is like a greased piglet! Can't get a solid hold on him. But moving to the table might actually work in my favor. I can keep a better eye on him from there, and the gem is still in my line of sight. Also, I need to keep him as far away from the bar as possible, as that is my goal.*

*Bob chuckles, accepting the change of scenery.*

"A dragon guarding the gems, eh? Now there's an idea! Though I reckon it would cost more to feed a dragon than the gems are worth in the first place! Plus, you know how dragons and gold are... they're like two peas in a pod, or... or... a gnome and a shiny gem." *Bob winks again, playfully poking at Homie.*

*Bob carefully moves behind the bar and grabs two more mugs, filling them with the house ale. I'm going to keep him plied with drinks, hopefully loosen his tongue, and keep him occupied.*

"Alright, alright, a seat sounds good," *Bob says, carefully taking the two mugs and moving to the table, keeping his eye on the golden mug behind the bar. He places one of the mugs in front of Homie and sits across from him.*

*As he sits, he makes an Insight check (rolls 16 + 3 = 19) to try and gauge Homie's true intentions. Is he really just interested in the story now, or is this another ploy?*

*Bob clears his throat and leans in conspiratorially*

"So, about this dragon... Her name is Veridiax, and she lives in the Crimson Peaks, north of here."

*Bob continues to watch Homie carefully, observing his body language and facial expressions as he begins the tale.*

"The tale goes that Veridiax was once a gentle dragon, a protector of the forest, but a band of greedy dwarves stole her hoard, and now she hates everyone. Everyone but the kind folks she trusts and who offer her gold. It's said that a single heartfelt compliment can melt her stony heart... but a single insult will earn you a fiery death."

*Bob pauses for dramatic effect, then takes a long swig of his ale.*

"I am going to attempt to get my trusty sword to protect the gem" *Bob whispers to himself*

*Bob casually reaches behind his back and grabs his trusty sword to make sure no one touches the gem*

*Bob looks around cautiously to make sure no one notices he just grabbed his sword.*

"Now, what was I saying? Oh right, the dragon. There was the time that she had to fight 100 goblins" *Bob says casually*

*Bob continues to watch Homie closely, ready to react if he makes any sudden moves. His hand is close to his sword, just in case.*

"What will be your next course of action? Does the patron truly want this gem? Does she need it? I must find out!" *Bob whispers*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Bob is too perceptive! I thought I could turn on the charm and get him distracted by the dragon tale, but he's still watching me like a hawk. Time for a more subtle approach. Maybe I can use this story to my advantage...*

*Homie takes a long sip of the ale, savoring the taste while subtly scanning the room. He notices that Bob has grabbed his sword. Time to change to a different action plan!*

"Veridiax, eh? A fascinating name. Tell me, Bob, this gem... is it something Veridiax might find *appealing*? Shiny objects and flattery, you said?" *Homie asks innocently, tilting his head slightly.*

*I need to find out if the dragon will protect the gems if offered!*

"So, with that in mind Bob, maybe we should attempt to visit this dragon? And by 'we' I mean you. I have heard that you're very good with these types of things, and it would be a great endeavor for you. I can hold down the fort for the day." *Homie says with a smile*

*Homie feigns interest in the story, while his mind races, planning his next move. If this works, he will have time alone to steal the gem!*

"Well, the thing is, maybe the owner isn't that trustworthy! Maybe we can take this gem to someone who is more trustworthy! What about that Bob!?" *Homie says*

"Just humor me Bob. How big is this gem?" *Homie asks inquisitively*

*I need to assess the gem, while also not being super direct*

*Homie leans forward conspiratorially.*

"And about those goblins... were they after anything in particular? Shiny gems, perhaps? Or just a good fight?"

*While Bob is distracted with the story, I will try to subtly move a chair in the direction of the exit, so when Bob turns back to the Bar, I can then make a run for it!*

*I'll make a Sleight of Hand check for this.*

*Rolls a d20... 18! Plus my +6 modifier for a total of 24!*

*I have successfully moved the chair without being noticed*

*Homie smiles slyly*

"Oh, the gems... If only I could get my hands on them for my own personal collection *Homie thinks to himself*"

*I need to make it seem like I am still on the dragon tale path, but also get the idea across that I really, really want to steal Bob. This way Bob does not notice that my true goal is getting him*

"I will attempt to casually get closer to Bob by asking how his family is doing, because if his family needs money, I can then offer it to them and Bob will be in my debt!

"So Bob, how is your family?" *Homie asks casually*

*As Homie moves the chair, I glance quickly to see if Bob has noticed!*

*I'll make a perception check for this*

*Rolls a d20... 4! Plus my +3 modifier for a total of 7!*

*Well, I hope he did not see anything, because my perception sucks! Time to just hope and pray!*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*This gnome is testing my patience. He's trying to pump me for information about the gem and the dragon, and now he's asking about my family? This is getting personal. I need to shut this down, and fast. And now he moved the chair? He may be attempting to run.*

*Bob takes a deep breath, trying to maintain his composure.*

"Homie, I appreciate your interest in the story, I truly do," *Bob says, his voice taking on a sterner tone, while casually moving to adjust his sword, making sure it is visible to Homie*. "But I'm a bit weary. It's been a long day, and I've got a tavern to run. I will humor your questions though."

*Bob pauses, narrowing his eyes slightly.*

"To answer your questions: yes, the gem is quite large, about the size of a gnome's head. And yes, the goblins were after anything shiny they could get their grubby little hands on."

*Bob leans forward, placing his hands on the table*

"But enough about dragons and goblins, Homie. Let's talk about you. What's *your* interest in all of this? You're asking an awful lot of questions about a gem that doesn't belong to you." *Bob glances at the exit and back to Homie to see if he is thinking about making a run for it*

*Bob then looks in the distance to gather himself*

"And as for my family, they're fine, thank you for asking. Though I do not understand the need for you to know." *Bob says calmly*

*Bob reaches for his mug and takes a long drink, never breaking eye contact with Homie. It is time for a show of dominance to maintain the gem's protection and make sure the gem is not stolen. He can feel Homie's true colors, and if he asks about his family, it is too far.*

*I need to try and intimidate Homie into ceasing his inquiries and keep him from getting closer to the exit, and focus on the gem. I am going to stand up and attempt to make myself seem larger and make sure that he stays right where he is and does not move*

*Bob stands up slowly, towering over Homie slightly. He makes an Intimidation check (rolls 17 + 2 = 19)*

"Now, I'm going to ask you nicely, Homie. Are you planning anything or are you going to leave?" *Bob says sternly*

*Bob grabs his sword as he stands up, to intimidate him.*

*Bob is at the ready to fight or call the guards if anything happens.*

*Bob needs to protect the mug.*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Blast it all! Bob's onto me. He's suspicious, he's pulled his sword, and he's giving me the stink eye. The 'family' ploy was a mistake. Time for damage control. I need to backpedal, appear harmless, and find another angle.*

"Whoa there, Bob! No need to get your tunic in a twist! I was just making conversation. A gnome's gotta be curious, you know? All those tales of dragons and goblins get the imagination going. Especially when a shiny gem is involved!" *Homie raises his hands in mock surrender, forcing a nervous chuckle*

*I need to calm the situation and make myself seem like an idiot.*

"Size of a gnome's head, you say? Well now, that *is* a whopper! Makes you wonder how you got it! Hehe" *Homie tries to laugh*

*I need to switch the topic to the drink, so it is not awkward at all and he does not realize I am thinking about stealing it*

"This is some good ale though, I can't lie."

*Homie slowly scoots the chair back to its original position, trying to seem compliant and non-threatening.*

"As for my interest, well, who wouldn't be interested in a story like that? Dragons, gems, adventure! It's the stuff of legends! No harm in asking a few questions, is there?" *He flashes a disarming smile, hoping to defuse the tension*

*I need to think fast! I need to think about stealing the gem! I can attempt to throw the chair at the bar and then jump behind the bar, or attempt to steal the gem?*

*He continues*

"You got me! I confess, I can not resist shiny objects. This does not mean I will steal it though!"

*Homie glances back towards the gem then back to Bob, and he takes a deep breath*

*I am very worried he will hurt me with that sword*

*Homie leans back and relaxes*

*He clears his throat*

"So, do you have a family? It is okay if you do not want to talk about it." *Homie says nervously*

*Homie is now very scared and nervous, but he needs to continue to stall and focus on the gem*

"Well, I should take off Bob! It was nice talking to you!" *Homie prepares to leave*



[SYSTEM: Homie's steal attempt: Homie fumbles the theft attempt! Roll: 8+6=14 vs DC 20]

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*This gnome is a slippery one. He's trying to backpedal now, but I can see the glint in his eye. He's still planning something. I need to keep the pressure on and make sure he knows I'm not buying his act. I will attempt to make a Persuasion check to kick him out, as that will protect the gem.*

*Bob stands his ground, his hand still resting on the hilt of his sword.*

"Homie, I appreciate the... honesty, I guess," *Bob says, his voice still firm. He leans in slightly, lowering his voice.* "But I've got a feeling about you, and it's not a good one. I protect my tavern and those inside it. And right now, that includes protecting that gem."



*Bob stares intently at Homie, his gaze unwavering. He's trying to convey that he knows Homie is up to no good, and that he's not afraid to take action.*

"Look, I'm not going to accuse you of anything outright," *Bob continues, his voice softening slightly. He takes a step back, giving Homie a bit more space.* "But I think it's best if you move on. Enjoy the rest of your night elsewhere."

*Bob gestures towards the door with his free hand, but his eyes remain fixed on Homie. Bob moves towards the exit door to make him more inclined to leave.*

"I will attempt to make sure that the door is as open as possible to show a safe exit." *Bob whispers.*

*Bob keeps a close eye on Homie, watching for any sudden movements or attempts to make a grab for the gem.*

*Bob is ready to attack if need be.*

*I need to make sure that this gnome leaves, and the gem stays in place at all costs.*

[SYSTEM: Bob's persuade attempt: Bob successfully performs the action! Roll: 13+4=17 vs DC 15]

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Bob is not buying it! I must retreat for now, but I will be back! This gem will be mine! He thinks he won, but I will make a new plan and approach this from a different angle. I just need to find the right opportunity.*

"Alright, alright, you've made your point loud and clear, Bob! No need to get all huffy. I was just admiring the... decor." *Homie gives the bar a cursory glance, then focuses his gaze on the exit.*

*Time to leave, but not without a little theatrics!*

"I'll be going then. But mark my words, Bob, this isn't over! I will acquire this gem!" *Homie says with a laugh*

*Homie dramatically pulls out a small smoke bomb from his pouch. With a flourish, he throws it on the ground, creating a cloud of thick, grey smoke.*



*While Bob is distracted by the smoke, I will use this as a chance to steal a small item, and the smoke should cover that!*



*Under the cover of the smoke, Homie makes a quick exit, disappearing into the night.*

*I need to come back with an elaborate plan!*

[SYSTEM: Homie's steal attempt: Homie successfully steals the small coin from the bar! Roll: 13+6=19 vs DC 15]

[SYSTEM: Homie's hide attempt: Homie successfully hides or sneaks around undetected! Roll: 17+6=23 vs DC 15]

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*That sneaky little gnome! He's gone, but I can't let my guard down. He managed to swipe something while he was at it, the nerve! I need to find out what he took and make sure he doesn't come back any time soon. And he is clearly coming back, so I will have to be prepared.*

*Bob coughs, waving away the dissipating smoke. He quickly scans the bar, assessing what Homie might have taken.*



*Once I determine what Homie stole, I will have to figure out a more permanent plan for him.*

"That blasted gnome!" *Bob mutters to himself, shaking his head in annoyance.*

*Bob moves to secure the gem, making sure it's still safe and sound.*

*Bob is also preparing himself for another visit from Homie in the future*

[ACTION: SECURE target: "Gem"]

*I need to find out if there is anything that Homie likes to steal.*

*Bob calls out to a regular patron, a gruff dwarf named Borin, who's nursing a tankard in the corner.*

"Borin! Did you happen to see what that little sneak took when he ran off?"

*Bob polishes a mug, keeping a watchful eye on the door.*

[SYSTEM: Bob's perception attempt: Bob successfully performs the action! Roll: 16+3=19 vs DC 15]

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Curses! Foiled again! But a gnome never gives up on shiny treasures! Bob thinks he's seen the last of me, but I'll be back, and I'll have that gem!*

*As I slip into the alleyway, I count my blessings (and my newly acquired coin). At least I managed to snag something before making my escape. Now, to formulate a new plan...*

*Thinking out loud while staring at the coin* "Alright, Homie, time for some serious strategizing! Bob is clearly on high alert, so brute force and charm are out. I need something more subtle, more... *clever*."

*I begin to strategize in the alley*

"Maybe... I need an accomplice! Someone to create a distraction while I sneak in and grab the gem. Or perhaps a disguise! Bob would never suspect a kindly old lady... or a particularly charming bard..." *I chuckle at the thought*

"But first, I need information. What are Bob's weaknesses? Does he have a soft spot for anything in particular? What are his routines? Knowledge is power, especially when it comes to thievery!"

*I start thinking of a plan*

*First, I need to watch the tavern from afar to learn Bob's habits and routines. Then I will attempt to make friends with the bartender so I can ask where he might put the gem*

*I have to be careful to not get caught again*

"Alright, Homie, time to go into stealth mode"



[SYSTEM: Homie's hide attempt: Homie successfully hides or sneaks around undetected! Roll: 17+6=23 vs DC 15]

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*That gnome is going to be a problem. He is going to be back, but next time I will be prepared. He said that he will come back for the gem, so the gem needs to be hidden or transported.*

*Bob nods slowly, considering Borin's input. He then glances around the tavern, noticing a couple of newer faces sitting at a table in the corner. They look like they might be mercenaries passing through.*

"Thanks, Borin, I appreciate it," *Bob says to the dwarf.*

*Bob tries to get a general idea of what these mercenaries are looking for or up to.*



*I need to protect the gem, and I think that may involve hiding the gem in my room for the night. The mercenaries could be useful for transporting the gem to a new location.*

"Well, I need to be careful here so that no one steals the gem and runs." *Bob says to himself*

[SYSTEM: Bob's perception attempt: Bob successfully performs the action! Roll: 17+3=20 vs DC 15]

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Bob is taking this very seriously! I need to be extra careful. I still plan to watch the tavern from afar and get the bartender to spill secrets.*

"Okay, Homie, first things first: Reconnaissance! I need to gather information. I need to learn everything I can about Bob and his precious gem... maybe I can even learn the password to his safe if he has one."

*I pull out my trusty spyglass and adjust it, focusing on the tavern's entrance from a hidden vantage point across the street.*

"Time to observe, learn, and plan. He will not suspect a thing!"

[ACTION: PERCEPTION target: "Bob's routines and habits", difficulty: "medium"]

🎲 Sleight of Hand check: [14+6=20 vs DC 15]
**SUCCESS**: Homie successfully performs the action!

"Alrighty then! *I rub my hands together with glee. Observing Bob's habits turned out to be easier than expected. He seems to have a weakness for those pickled eggs and a strong aversion to cleaning under the counter - perfect!*

*I glance at the bar, spotting the gem gleaming in the low light. Bob's currently distracted by regaling a patron with a long-winded fishing tale.*

*It's time to put my observations to good use. With Bob busy and hopefully nobody noticing my small stature, I'll attempt a stealthy maneuver toward the gem.*

[ACTION: HIDE target: "behind the bar", advantage: "advantage"]

*I take a deep breath, trying to remember the gnome mantra: 'In shadows, we dance; with nimble hands, we advance.'*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*That blasted gnome! He thinks he's so clever, but I'm going to be ready for him. He's watching me, learning my routines, but I can play that game too. I need to give him a false sense of security, make him think he's got me figured out, then BAM! I'll be ready to catch him red-handed.*

*Bob chuckles to himself, a mischievous glint in his eye. He deliberately takes a pickled egg from the jar behind the bar, savoring it slowly as he glances towards the door, as if expecting Homie to pop back in any minute.*

"Alright, time for a little act," *Bob says softly.*

*Bob clears his throat, then raises his voice, addressing the tavern in general.*

"Say, folks, I'm feeling a bit tired tonight! Think I'll be turning in early. Don't want to leave the bar unattended, of course, so I'll just be heading upstairs to my room. But don't worry, I'll leave the gem right here on the counter! It'll be safe as houses, I'm sure."

*Bob feigns a yawn, stretching theatrically. He then grabs a duster and begins "cleaning" the counter around the gem, making sure to leave the area under the counter particularly dusty.*

*I am pretending that I don't care, so Homie will feel more confident.*

[ACTION: DECEIVE target: "Homie", skill: "Deception", difficulty: "medium"]

*While "cleaning", I need to try to identify what Homie's current approach is.*

[ACTION: PERCEPTION target: "Homie's movements", skill: "Perception", difficulty: "medium"]

🎲 Perception check: [8+3=11 vs DC 15]
**FAILURE**: Bob fails to perform the action successfully.

*Darn it, I missed whatever Homie was up to! I have to keep an eye on that one, especially. He always seems to be sniffing around when something valuable is involved. And the gem... well, that's the most valuable thing in this whole tavern right now.*

"Say, friend," *Bob says, turning back to the patron at the bar*, "did you see that gnome, Homie, flitting about just now? Seemed a bit shifty, even for him. I thought he might be heading toward you" *Bob says with a reassuring chuckle.* "Just curious if he caused any trouble, is all. I wouldn't want anyone causing trouble in my establishment!"

[ACTION: PERSUADE target: "customer", advantage: "advantage"]

*Bob will use this as an excuse to get a closer look at the customer and see if he is trying to distract Bob, which could indicate they are working together.*

*I need to make sure the gem is safe. Perhaps moving it while I have a brief lull in customers would be best.*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Bob thinks he can outsmart Homie? He's about to find out that gnomes are trickier than they look! Bob is trying to lull me into a false sense of security. Ha! But I have a trick up my sleeve.*

*I see Bob moving toward his room and I realize I need to act fast! I can not allow him to move the gem, which will make it harder to steal.*

*I carefully sneak behind the bar while he is talking to the patron*

[ACTION: STEAL target: "gem", skill: "Sleight of Hand", difficulty: "medium"]

🎲 Sleight of Hand check: [2+6=8 vs DC 20]
**FAILURE**: Homie fumbles the theft attempt!

"Whoopsie daisy!" *I quickly cover my tracks, hoping no one noticed my fumbling fingers.*

*Internally, I'm assessing the situation: 'Blast! I need to be more careful. Distraction, that's what I need. A good distraction should do the trick.*'

*I slap my hands on my thighs, feigning ignorance.*

"Well, that was a harder lock than I thought. Guess it's a good thing I'm just a simple gnome, eh?" I say with a chuckle, hoping to deflect suspicion.

*My eyes dart back to the gem behind the bar. Must. Have. It.*

"Say, while you're all distracted by the contents of this here chest, I think I'll pop over to the bar and see if they have any... uh... *particularly* interesting ales. Always important to stay hydrated, right?"

[ACTION: PERCEPTION target: "bartender's attention"]

*I'll use this moment to try and assess how closely guarded that gemstone is. Then, I can begin the charm offensive!*

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*That blasted gnome! He's definitely up to something. I need to keep him distracted, but I also need to make sure the gem is safe. I need to convince the tavern that I'm moving the gem upstairs, but secretly hide it in a much safer spot that is easier to access.*

*Bob stops his exaggerated yawning and chuckles softly, patting his apron pocket where his coin purse is located.*

"Alright, alright, settle down folks. Old Bob here might be getting a bit tired, but I'm not senile just yet! I wouldn't leave something valuable like the gem just sitting out in the open. Though this gem is just a decoration and not that valuable." *Bob says with a wink and a grin*

*I need to see how they respond to the gem being potentially valueless.*

*Bob lowers his voice, leaning in conspiratorially.*

"Truth be told," *Bob whispers*, "I'm just trying to see who's got sticky fingers! There's been a few odd things happenin' lately, and I'm just testin' the waters, so to speak."

*Bob straightens up and claps his hands together.*

"Now, about that ale, friend! What can I get for you? And don't worry, I'll keep a close eye on things while I'm behind the bar here."

*Bob looks towards Homie and smiles.*

"Everything alright there, Homie? You seemed to be trying something back there?"

[ACTION: PERCEPTION target: "Homie's movements", skill: "Perception", difficulty: "medium"]

🎲 Perception check: [3+3=6 vs DC 15]
**FAILURE**: Bob fails to perform the action successfully.

*Blast it all! I need to keep an eye on that blasted gnome. I'll have to find another way to watch him.*

"What'll it be, friend?"

*I need to try and subtly distract Homie so I can move the gem when he is looking away.*

[ACTION: PERSUADE target: "Homie", skill: "Persuasion", difficulty: "hard"]

"Say, Homie, that reminds me, have you seen the new shipment of gemstones that arrived in town? I'm sure someone like you would be interested."

*I casually glance around the tavern to assess if anyone else is showing interest in the conversation.*

conversations.speaker: Homie
conversations.message:
*Bob is trying to be all sly, saying the gem isn't valuable. But Homie doesn't believe a word of it! It's shining brighter than a dragon's hoard, I tell you! And now he's directly asking me if I'm up to something? Oh, he's good, he's good. Time for some misdirection of my own...*

"Why, Bob, you wound me!" I say, placing a hand dramatically over my heart (or where my heart *would* be, if it weren't buried under a layer of thieving instinct). "I was just admiring your... um... *exquisite* collection of bar towels! Such artistry! Such absorbent qualities!" *I give the nearest towel a suspicious sniff.* "And perhaps wondering if you might have a good deal on a slightly used one? For... purely hygienic reasons, of course."

*I give Bob a wide, innocent-ish smile.*

"New gemstones in town, you say? Ooh, where?" *I feign excitement, trying to make it seem like that's what I'm really interested in.* "Perhaps they have some... uh... *sparkling* options that might distract from my, shall we say, *slightly* weathered appearance? A gnome's gotta keep up appearances, you know!"

[ACTION: DECEPTION target: "Bob", skill: "Deception", difficulty: "medium"]

conversations.speaker: Bob
conversations.message:
*That blasted gnome is slicker than a greased goblin. He's definitely interested in something, and I bet my bottom dollar it's the gem. I need to play along, but I also need to get the gem out of sight.*

"Bar towels, eh? Why, Homie, you flatter me! I didn't know anyone appreciated a good bar towel as much as I do. I get them imported from Waterdeep, you know, the finest cotton. But I'm afraid I don't have any used ones for sale. Wouldn't be sanitary, now, would it?" *Bob chuckles, feigning amusement.*

*I need to make a decision to get the gem out of sight. I think I will place it behind the bar for now to make it seem like it is unguarded.*

"New gemstones, you say? Aye, they arrived just this mornin' at the merchant's guild. Big shipment from the mines of Mirabar, I hear. All sorts of shiny things, I expect. But I wouldn't know much about gemstones myself. My adventuring days were more about bashing skulls than appreciating sparkly rocks." *Bob winks at the other patrons, then turns back to Homie, lowering his voice.*

"Tell you what, Homie, why don't you go check them out? I'll keep an eye on your, uh, *hygienic* interests here at the bar. Just be careful, there's bound to be other interested parties sniffin' around." *Bob raises an eyebrow, giving Homie a knowing look.*

*While Homie is thinking about his answer, I need to grab the gem and move it behind the bar to a less conspicuous location. I'll place it on the shelf with the mugs and dishes, partially hidden.*

[ACTION: HIDE target: "gem behind the bar", skill: "Sleight of Hand", difficulty: "easy"]

*I am hoping this makes it seem like I don't care too much about the gem while making it difficult for Homie to grab it without me seeing.*
